author: Ian Sandwell
title: Rooney Mara speaks out about the Hollywood gender pay gap: "It's just a reality of the time that we live in" - Showbiz
text: Rooney Mara has joined the debate on the Hollywood gender pay gap.The Pan star shared her thoughts on the topic in the light of Jennifer Lawrence's recent essay. © Warner Bros PicturesRooney Mara in Pan "I've been in films where I've found out my male co-star got paid double what I got paid, and it's just a reality of the time we live in," Mara told The Guardian."To me, it's frustrating, but at the same time, I'm just grateful to be getting paid at all for what I do. "It's not fair, but I think about how much teachers are getting paid, or other people who are doing jobs that are so much more important than what I do, and it's kind of hard to complain about it." © Getty Images Mara also revealed that she agrees with Lawrence about the terms used to describe female actors, and added that she believes the difference in speaking to men and women is more unfair than the pay gap."I've been called horrible things. If a man was acting in the same way that I was acting, it would just be considered normal," Mara noted."To me, that's the thing I find so frustrating is calling women spoiled brats and bitches. We just want to have a voice in our life, and I don't think that's anything that shouldn't be encouraged in any human."Jessica Chastain and Bradley Cooper both came out in support of Lawrence last week, with Chastain saying she was "proud" of the Hunger Games star for speaking out. © Rex Features Lawrence's American Hustle co-star Cooper added that he believes that her views are "making a difference".Many women in Hollywood have spoken up about inequality recently, with Thelma and Louise star Geena Davis saying it's "frustrating" to work in an industry where men and women are not considered equal.Sienna Miller also recently revealed she quit a play due to the significant pay difference between herself and her male co-star.Meanwhile, Gwyneth Paltrow has said that her Avengers co-star Robert Downey Jr isn't worth the huge paycheques he receives.
